SENT.plain: We report the case of a male with Buerger's disease and neurologic involvement
Cerebral arteriography showed multiple distal arterial obliterans with left-sided Moya-moya phenomena
Thromboangiitis obliterans is a chronic segmental occlusive disease affecting medium-sized and small arteries and veins throughout the body
Neurologic signs are rare, occurring in fewer than 2 % of cases, and most often found on the cortical surface and adjacent territories
We review the most common signs of this entity and its main diagnostic difficulties
